title: Drawing, "Six Antique Gods and Goddesses", after 1850
medium: Pen and brown ink, over black chalk with traces of graphite on laid paper
markings: Watermark: lily in double circle; below AP, above P
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Vertical rectangle. One below the other, standing upon a line. A sacrificing woman, carrying in left hand torch; caption: "Pluto." Warrior walking carrying trophy; between two trophies, right one composing thunder-bolt; caption: "Gione" Apollo standing and playing lyre; at left, rolls lying, at right, other objects; caption: "Apollo." Woman hurries to sacrifice at altar; black chalk: the stake upon which Hercules lies is lighted.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Six Antique Gods and Goddesses", after 1850.
after 1850. Pen and brown ink, over black chalk with traces of graphite on laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-1064.
